title: Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
description:
Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague**Job Description**
  

  

AWM delivers innovative investment solutions through a global, multi- product platform that offers clients the advantages that come with working with a large firm, while maintaining the benefits of a boutique. AWM is one of the pre-eminent investment management organizations globally. Critical to the success of AWM is our ability to leverage a global team of talented professionals to define solutions and lead change across the operational infrastructure.
  

  

The AM Operations Global Data Governance team is seeking to add a highly motivated professional to its organization. This team is primarily focused on building & maintaining a scalable Data Governance framework for data attributes published in internal and external reports. The Data Governance team works closely with Operations, Business, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing data pipelines and maintaining data value chains connected to various reporting outputs of the organization.
  

  

With your expertise, our data owners, stewards, and subject matter experts can ensure the integrity of our data throughout its lifecycle. Your contribution will lead to trusted data for our clients, our investment processes, and operations.
  

  

**Responsibilities**
  

* Leverage analytical skills, creative problem solving and project management skills to steer and uplift the existing Data Governance model.
* Organize discussions with key stakeholders to understand how our technology works, thereby empowering you to define specific data attributes, identify the relevant owners, and source system(s) along with Data flows.
* Improve the risk framework for data governance by documenting existing controls, analyzing their suitability, and recommending new controls for implementation.
* Develop strong working relationships with Sales, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing the Data Governance model and keeping it up to date.
* Work with Business Intelligence & Low code Automation solutions to digitize the Data Governance framework and improve efficiency.
* Regularly assess and refine data governance processes and policies in line with the industry best practice to promote continuous improvement.

  

**Qualifications**
  

* Bachelor's/ Master's Degree (Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Management)
* Understanding of data governance concepts, principles, and best practices
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Excellent communication, both in listening and conveying messages to a wide range of stakeholder groups
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to handle multiple projects, deadlines, personalities, and broad based coverage
* Knowledge and understanding of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and adaptability to other software products
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Knowledge of the investment management industry and GSAM is a bonus
* A basic idea of Business Intelligence and data visualisation tools is a bonus

  

**ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS**
  

  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Senior Data Scientist Transaction Monitoring
description:
Senior Data Scientist Transaction Monitoring**The team**
  

  

ING's goal is to enable people to "do their thing" and empower them to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are one of the largest banks in Europe and we continuously evolve to become one of the most innovative companies in the banking sector. The ING Analytics group is a major driving force in ING's transformation, aimed at helping us to become a data-driven organization, where advanced analytics is at the heart of our business processes.
  

  

In our tribe COOA, we apply analytics & AI solutions for the Financial Crime & Fraud domains and create advanced analytics applications and models. These models are used to mitigate and to effectively tackle the risk of financial crime for our customers and our society, making us a safer and more compliant bank. Our group consists of more than two dozen data scientists, engineers, data analysts, and customer journey experts, working together to deliver innovative solutions in our domain across multiple countries.
  

  

**Roles and responsiblities**
  

  

As we continue our growth and establishing the added value analytics bring to our domains, we seek to a senior data science profile in order to:
  

  

* Develop an expertise in applying and deploying machine learning for outlier detection, representation learning, entity resolution, and network & graph applications.

  

* Adopt best practices and quality standards for developing & deploying fit-for-purpose model pipelines, addressing the requirements of the ING model governance.

  

* Be an effective member of a model development & implementation squad, challenge the status quo and build what matters.

  

* Actively learn about our domain, reach out to our stakeholders, and tell captivating stories with our data to create a journey that makes our bank and our society safer.

  

**Who should apply?**
  

  

At ING, we promote diversity not just because it is the right thing to do, but because it's essential for delivering on our strategy. In order to stay a step ahead we need teams with a healthy mix of contrasting perspectives and backgrounds as they are more creative, faster to adapt and more inventive with their solutions. We strive to hire a workforce as diverse as the communities in which we operate, and we will consider every application, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability or age.
  

  

**How to succeed**  

  

  

* You have at least 5 years of (global) work experience in the Data Science space (methods, technology, data) including putting machine learning models into production
  

  

* You have extensive experience in writing production-grade python code that is scalable and deployable to multiple countries
  

  

* You have knowledge of a wide range of machine learning algorithms, ranging from more classical econometric models to cutting-edge neural networks and are able to match them to business problems
  

  

* Experience in applying data science to prevent and detect financial crimes (e.g. internal/external fraud, money laundering, terrorism financing, tax evasion, ...) is a strong plus
  

  

* You can explain complicated subjects clearly
  

  

* You are friendly and approachable and are able to mentor junior data scientists
  

  

* Your enthusiasm is visible and you are good with mobilizing people for our data driven purpose
  

  

* You are motivated to keep on top of the latest developments in data science and software engineering
  

  

* You are able to see where ING can set further steps towards becoming a truly data driven bank. You're always thinking one step ahead, for example in advising about the best way of implementation.
  

  

* You are a team player who strikes effective balance between independence and acting in the interest of the team

  

**Experience**  

  

  

* MSc or PhD with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics or similar is a plus
  

  

* Software engineering and MLOps
  

  

* Machine Learning: Classification, Regression, Clustering, Unsupervised methods, Text Mining. ML models including Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Neural Networks, Logistic Regression, SVM, KNN, K-Means, etc. Parametric and non-parametric statistics.
  

  

* Programming Languages: Python (including pySpark)
  

  

* Tools: Spark, Hadoop
  

  

* Database handling: SQL, Hive. Familiarity with Oracle, Netezza, HBase, Cassandra, Graph databases.
  

  

* Visualisation tools: D3.js, Shiny, Angular

title: Cyber Security Governance Analyst
description:
Cyber Security Governance Analyst
We at, ING CISO Domestic Bank NL (DBNL), are looking for a highly motivated and detail oriented individual to join our team as a Security Awareness and Reporting Expert who will support the CISO department and the IT organization for the Netherlands Domestic Bank.
  

  

**Role and Responsibilities**
  

* Develop, deliver and maintain engaging security awareness training content tailored to different employee groups.
* Lead the planning and coordination of various security awareness sessions, risk awareness days for DBNL.
* Analyze security awareness training data and metrics to measure program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
* Develop and maintain clear and concise communication materials to promote security awareness across the organization through newsletters and advisory content.
* Prepare monthly security and risk governance reports for senior management, drive the agenda and lead the security and risk evaluation meetings.
* Collaborate with Global Security teams, IT Risk and Cyber Operations teams to Monitor and report on status and progress of IT-risk and security compliance state and overall security KPIs and KRIs.
* Stay up-to-date on the evolving cybersecurity landscape and emerging threats.

  

**How to succeed**
  

* Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Good understanding Cyber security frameworks e.g NIST, CSA
* Good understanding of security metrics, KPIs and KRIs
* Certifications like CISSP, CISM, CRISC or CISA
* Minimum of 5 years of experience developing and implementing security awareness programs.
* Proven experience in creating engaging and effective security awareness training content.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong analytical skills and critical thinking
* Strong stakeholder management skills.

  

**Rewards & benefits**
  

  

We want to make sure that you can strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* Hybrid working mode (flexible working from home and office).
* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience.
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th-month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% Holiday payment.
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities.
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues.
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster.

  

**About us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Senior NLP/LLM Data Scientist
description:
Senior NLP/LLM Data Scientist
ING Analytics is responsible for realizing this vision for ING, differentiating ING as a leader in data-driven organization, within the banking sector and beyond. The team consists of a number of Global Analytics Centre of Excellences around the bank's key capabilities (such as Pricing, Risk Management, Financial Crime, Customer Intelligence and People Analytics.) as well as strong coordination areas around data management, technology, customer journey, UX and external partnerships.
  

  

**Roles and responsibilities**
  

  

You will be part of the COO Analytics Tribe. In our tribe, we apply advanced analytics & Gen AI solutions for the Financial Crime domain globally as well as customer centre analytics. Traditional ML models and Gen AI solutions are used to detect, mitigate and to effectively tackle the risk of financial crime for our customers and our society, making us a safer and more compliant bank. Our tribe consists of more than two dozen data scientists, engineers, data analysts, and customer journey experts, working together to deliver innovative solutions in our domain across multiple countries.
  

  

Specifically, you will help creating innovative and scalable solutions in the area of Contact Center Analytics (CCA). You will work collaboratively with a broad group of stakeholders, including global and local CCA units to define and develop the solutions and consequently you will work with technical teams to implement these solutions across the organization.
  

  

We work in a fun and creative environment, and we're dedicated to bringing out the best in both our relations and our projects, ranging from traditional machine learning algorithms to detect suspicious behaviors to enhance our processes by applying innovative techniques such as Generative AI and Large Language Models to building solutions across all countries ING operates in.
  

  

**Your focus areas will be:**
  

* Design and implementation of solutions using Generative AI and LLM technologies
* Working with our engineering team to productionize your solution
* Using the cutting-edge frameworks and technologies such as generative AI and Large Language Models
* Following best practices in developing ML code and ML software tests
* Keeping pace with the evolution and best practices in the GenAI and NL domain
* Assisting your model users to understand the data science principles and when needed explaining the model behavior and possible corrective actions.
* Contributing to strengthening the analytical capability within the team.
* Actively learn about our domain, reach out to our stakeholders, and tell captivating stories with our data to create a journey that makes our bank and our society safer

  

**How to succeed**
  

* Always thinking a step ahead and never satisfied with the status quo
* Enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a talent for taking it on and making it happen
* You have a learning attitude. Not only to master new technologies and programming languages, but also on the interpersonal level. You are proven to be able to ask and give feedback
* You embrace challenges in a fast-changing and complex environment
* You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals
* You have a Pro-active and can-do attitude (self-steering)
* You take pride in your code and take responsibility for keeping it running in production
* You combine both thinking of the future and a hands-on, right now attitude
* You enjoy working in a team, with highly skilled people, having a creative atmosphere where trying out new things is encouraged.
  

  

* MSc or PhD in Computer Science or similar domain, and preferably in Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, or Machine Learning.
* A minimum of 3 years experience in building Natural Language Processing or Information Retrieval pipelines and models
* Experience with operationalisation of LLMs or Generative AI applications
* You have an in-depth understanding of algorithms like Conditional Random Fields, Transformers, Recurrent Neural Networks, and Convolutional Neural Network
* Strong programming skills in Python, experience in delivering production grade code, and reasonable SQL understanding
* Can build an "end-to-end ML software product" which has NLP/IR component
* Experience with Deep Learning frameworks like Tensorflow and PyTorch
* You have excellent oral and written communication skills at the technical and business level
* Fluent in written and spoken English.
* Familiarity with Agile Scrum way of working

  

**Nice To Have**
  

* Experience with Google Cloud Platform
* Experience with applying NLP in banking domain
* Knowledge of DevOps practices including Git and CI/CD
* Experience with CI/CD for Machine Learning pipeline (CD4ML).
* Experience with traditional ML algorithms is a plus

  

**Rewards & Benefits**
  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm
  

  

**The benefits of working with us at ING include:**
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience.
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th-month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% Holiday payment.
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation.
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities.
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues.

  

**About Us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse, and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Customer Journey Expert/Business Analyst Reporting - Tribe Investments NL
description:
Customer Journey Expert/Business Analyst Reporting - Tribe Investments NL
Are you passionate about investments and want to help contribute to our growth ambition? This is the chance for you! We are looking for a CJE/ Business Analyst for our shared platform who wants to take on the challenge to make our platform ready for the next steps. Our shared platform reaches from our Back-end system Europort to our mobile banking app and everything in between.
  

  

**The work environment**
  

  

At Investments, we make investing accessible and help our customers grow their money. We support them to become the best investors they can be with a compelling value proposition and an excellent digital experience. For moments that matter, we offer touchpoints with trusted advisors. Ous shared platform is currently servicing both Dutch and Belgium clients and we are preparing to onboard the next country on our platform Italy.
  

  

Investments serves ING's retail, private banking and business banking customers. We operate in a complex and highly regulated value chain with strong competition, rapid technological developments, and high commercial ambitions. One of our commercial ambitions is to grow within Private banking. To do so we want to expand the Lombard Loans offering. For that we need to setup Securities Finance reporting. We are looking for someone who is passionate about continuously improving our procedures and reporting. This position will be in the team Europort & Operations that is responsible for all operational Investments procedures and reporting for NL and BE.
  

  

Within Europort & Operations we are cross border responsible for all transaction flows on the Backend platform and reporting and client output to our customers. The teams exists of Customer Journey Experts and IT engineers. Together with them you strive to improve the processes you own and keep them compliant.
  

  

**Your role and responsibilities**
  

* Bringing the platform to a higher (technical) standard and expand the number of functionalities we offer,
* Together with your Product Lead defining the roadmap for the product, translate that into deliverables, and support the team in reaching the goals defined,
* Proactively engaging stakeholders to ensure further expansion of the use of our capabilities throughout the bank,
* Helping to reduce time to market, enrich customer journeys, and drive cost savings by making our product,
* Maintaining the IT landscape needed to support all this.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

Furthermore, you have:
  

* Current residency in the Netherlands;
* Like to do stakeholder management: we service both Belgium and Dutch clients. Dutch language skills are a strong benefit;
* Worked in a complex architectural application landscape. You understand what changes are needed and have the skills to analyze it and create a new solution;
* A passion for investments: you know our products and you are willing to put time and energy in increasing your craftmanship in the field of investments;
* Strong affinity with Business to IT: writing stories, hunting bugs, refinement, testing and putting releases to production is one of the key elements of your job;
* Very data-savvy. Databases are not new to you and it is an absolute pre if you have at least some basic skills with Oracle SQL;
* Like to work in a complex environment where a strong growth ambition, complex rules and regulations and IT challenges come together;
* A digital first mindset and have an idea on how we can develop our products in such a way that processes are simple and STP (Straight-Through Processing);
* Can handle pressure in case of incident management.

  

Don't worry if you do not meet all the criteria. If you feel that you might be a good fit for this position, we would love to hear from you. Always provide a cover letter telling us your story.
  

  

**Rewards & benefits**  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

  

**Want to apply directly?**  

  

Upload your **CV and motivation letter** by clicking the "Apply" button.
  

  

Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.
  

  

**About us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us and apply today!

title: Business Analyst Model Risk
description:
Business Analyst Model Risk
ING's purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. Our strategy is built around our purpose and making the difference for people and the planet. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, a strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network. If you want to work at a place where we believe that you can make the difference by using machine learning to generate data driven products and solve the most pressing business challenges, please read on.
  

  

**ING Model Risk Oversight**
  

  

Model Risk Oversight (MRO) is a fast growing, energetic, international team of highly qualified Model Risk Experts, Business Analysts, and Developers. MRO is developing and rolling out the new Model Risk Management (MoRM) framework which scope covers all models used within ING Bank worldwide. To further strengthen and manage the model risk management activities, MRO expands. The Risk Hub Model Risk Oversight Chapter supports/guides global and local model communities in execution of the model life cycle activities, together with Global MRO team facilitates oversight, monitoring model risk, and reporting for local entities. At ING Group we the Agile approach and mindset. We are innovative and we trust people we work with. The broad autonomy our employees have, stimulates motivation and creativity what allows us to adapt to the changing requirements of business partners. Small units called squads are the core of our organization. They have clear vision of products, overcome challenges autonomously and based on team cooperation, work out the most flexible and effective way of working.
  

  

**Model Risk Inventory Solution (iModel) Business Partner job purpose**
  

  

You will be part of ING MoRM MRO Reporting and Inventory Squad, that is in charge of helping set and execute model risk inventory management and reporting strategy, monitor model portfolio & collaborating with stakeholders in showing value of Model Risk Management.
  

  

**Role and responsibilities:**
  

  

Ensure complex Model Risk Management initiatives are translated into business requirements and/or features/stories by using business knowledge:
  

* you are able to translate new framework / policies, procedures, reporting needs into required model inventory solution and requirements,
* you think and act globally and grasp business opportunities or identify pain points to be addressed
* you highlight correlation and dependencies between squads within different parts of the organization.

  

Responsible for the solution design and strategy how to use to show what is needed and how the End-to-End solution will work:
  

* this involves creating a blueprint or high-level overview of the proposed solution, outlining the key features;
* you are able to analyse the data extracted from the system to drive the improvement
* raising proposals (business cases) of new improvement initiatives;
* you are responsible for the due diligence refinement in a marketplace requests prepared by solution key users focusing on sufficient granularity for the development team to initially assess delivery. Ensure compliance with main policies and frameworks, resolve data maintenance and process handling ownership etc. You conduct, review and maintain on topics as general solution concept, workflows, design records, proof of concepts, all this specifications are duly documented.
* during the development phase, you coordinate if additional refinement with requestors are needed and support to the development team,
* you play a crucial role in evaluating and selecting from various options of solution proposed by asset owner. You assess various options and make recommendations based on factors such as regulatory compliance, business case compatibility, performance, security, and cost-effectiveness, process leanness.

  

Ensure features delivery (Planning, coordination, dependencies management):
  

* you are and feel responsible for the end-to-end integration and realization of the solution change delivery work (across squads and/or Tribes). You oversee progress and coordinate the dependencies and address impediments across the whole chain,
* you identify (and manage) risks and potential issues and offer improvements across Tribes,
* you identify and manage dependencies for features and epics across different Tribes.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We are looking for you, if you:
  

* have experience working in a bank or a financial institution
* have an experience in process analysis or refining and designing business requirements for integrated system solutions,
* have project management skills in achieving deadlines and milestones; and communication skills with wide range of stakeholders
* have an excellent knowledge of model risk management solutions or other complex data inventory management and workflow systems,
* have proven track record in reducing complexity of delivering complex change management initiatives across multiple teams,
* demonstrates mastery in writing skills - understandable and easy to read features,
* are a good presenter who can convey stories well between business and IT stakeholders.

  

**You'll get extra points for:**
  

* proven experience in maintaining solution architectures, business analysis, process analysis
* problem solving skills to find creative ways of driving progress and removing impediments,
* empowering and challenging squad/chapter members to foster collaboration and individual development,
* strong co-creation skills like workshop facilitation, constructive feedback loops, and prototyping,
* strong stakeholder management skills. Ability to challenge, influence or convince others through fact-based arguments, especially experience with senior management
* self-disciplined, very proactive and organized, with ability to identify what needs to be done.

  

**Rewards and benefits**  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at http://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm. The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
  

  

**What do we offer?**
  

  

A strategic, dynamic and international setting, an innovative and fast-moving Analytics team and great development opportunity. If this is the environment you thrive in, then **apply and join us** in changing the future of banking!

title: Chapter Lead Business Analyst - DBNL Finance Information Management
description:
Chapter Lead Business Analyst - DBNL Finance Information Management
Chapter Lead Business Analyst - DBNL Finance Information Management
  

  

Our question
  

* Are you an experienced Business Analyst that enjoys working Agile?
* Do you have strong people skills and love coaching others on the job?

  

So, we are looking for you!
  

  

**Your work environment**
  

  

ING's strategy is centered around providing a best in class experience to its customers, aiming to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and business. Innovation is considered to be a core enabler to accomplish this mission, especially given the fast changing environment we live in today. From a Finance perspective this means being in control at all times of ING's financials while making sure that ING continuously adapts to meet the changing and more data oriented regulatory and statutory reporting requirements.
  

  

Finance Domestic Bank is responsible for the financial accounting and reporting of all Retail activities in ING's home market, with a Balance Sheet of 200 billion euro and responsible for 40% of ING's worldwide profit.The Financial Accounting tribe aims at finding the balance between high speed to continuously deliver on all regulatory changes and an efficient and up-to-standard way of working to process vast data sets according to strict IFRS and ECB rules.
  

  

In Finance Information Management, which is part of Financial Accounting Tribe within ING Domestic Bank Netherlands, we enable the delivery of valuable and reliable financial information and data of high quality to fulfil ING's reporting obligations and to support decision making both for Financial Accounting and Finance Business Advice.
  

  

Information Management consists of a team of 25 people of different nationalities, most of them Business Analysts, working in squads with Dev Engineers. The team continuously adapts to changes in the bank's business, its products, processes, services and IT infrastructure, to ensure proper reflection in the financial and management reporting. Together with the end users, the team is responsible to ensure we continuously comply with the changing regulatory reporting, business and data requirements. Within this challenging environment we give the opportunity to experiment, learn and adapt to bring the best possible future proof solutions and value to our stakeholders.
  

  

**What will you do?**
  

  

We are looking for a strong and enthusiastic Chapter Lead Business Analyst to be the hierarchical manager of around 8 Business Analysts (BA's) of Finance Information Management . In this role, you also work on the craftmanship of the team, and you are responsible for setting standards for processes, methodologies, policies and tools which will be used by the BA's.
  

  

Besides the business analysis chapter, you will also be leading a group of 3 colleagues who orchestrate data quality process, data privacy and the project portfolio within Financial Accounting, as well as monitor the control execution and run activities on Information Management perimeter.
  

  

We expect you to...
  

* act as an Agile role model
* coach Business Analysts on (Agile) mindset, behavior, craftmanship and continuous improvement
* introduce best practices to Business Analysts
* perform the PCB (Planning, Coaching, Appraisal) cycle with all chapter members
* ensure qualitative alignment between Business Analyst Chapter members and the Product Owners
* support & structure the growth and career trajectories of our Business Analysts
* enable our squads to make an impact
* discuss Business Analyst Chapter progress in skills development and future demand with management
* ensure as much as possible the use of ING standard processes and tools
* take a role in delivery, orchestrating activities related to data quality, financial accounting project follow-up, and monitoring of data privacy, information management controls and run activities
* act to enhance end-to-end process analysis and data skills among the team

  

**Who are we looking for? Someone who has...**
  

* 5+ years proven track record at management level in an Agile busdevops environment
* Experience as Business Analyst and leading projects
* Good knowledge of banking products and accounting processes
* Experience working in a data driven environment and strong analytical skills
* Education at Bachelor/Master level in (business) economics/Information technology or similar

  

We value mindset above experience, learning above knowledge and team spirit above specialist. But with this, we build a team that excels in its ability to bring new solutions to existing questions, but also to the questions of the future.
  

  

**Agile way of Working**
  

  

We work according to ING Agile way of working principles. Important aspects in our way of working are showing flexibility, taking initiative and responsibility, continuous learning and improvement, cooperation and actively entering a positive dialogue with others.
  

  

**Rewards & benefits**  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

  

**Want to apply directly?**  

  

Upload your **CV and motivation letter** by clicking the "Apply" button.
  

  

Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.
  

  

**About us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us and apply today!

title: Business Analyst (Customer Journey Expert) for Investments
description:
Business Analyst (Customer Journey Expert) for Investments
Are you passionate about investments and want to help contribute to our growth ambition? This is the chance for you! We are looking for a Customer Journey Expert/business analyst for our shared platform who wants to take on the challenge to make our platform ready for the next steps. Our shared platform reaches from our Back-end system Europort to our mobile banking app.
  

  

**The team | Investments**  

  

At Investments, we make investing accessible and help our customers grow their money. We support them to become the best investors they can be with a compelling value proposition and an excellent digital experience. For moments that matter, we offer touchpoints with trusted advisors. Our shared platform is currently servicing both Dutch and Belgium clients and we are preparing to onboard the next country on our platform: Italy.
  

  

Investments serves ING's retail, private banking and business banking customers. We operate in a complex and highly regulated value chain with strong competition, rapid technological developments, and high commercial ambitions. This makes it a very interesting environment to work in.
  

  

**Your role and responsibilities**
  

  

You work together in an international team with other Customer Journey Experts, front end and back end developers both onside and offshore. Together with your team you are end to end responsible for all client data processes for Investments. You maintain, improve and rebuild the processes so the right clients can do the right activities for the right account. Examples of activities you do in your squad:
  

* Connect all api's within Investments to the Global Retention Policy platform in order to automate the process of deleting client data after the retention policy has passed,
* Making the syncing process of client data between Investments and the central database more robust, making sure Dutch; Belgium and in the very near future Italian clients are guaranteed smooth Investment journeys,
* Together with your Product Lead defining the roadmap for the processes, translate that into deliverables, and support the team in reaching the goals defined,
* Proactively engaging stakeholders to ensure further expansion of the use of our capabilities throughout the bank,
* Helping to reduce time to market, enrich customer journeys, and drive cost savings by making our processes simple and smooth,
* Maintaining the IT landscape needed to support all this.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

Furthermore, you have/are/can:  

  

  

* **Current residency in the Netherlands** and have excellent English skills both verbally and written, Dutch is a plus
* Get **energised by stakeholder management**: we service both Belgium and Dutch clients and in the very near future we will onboard Italy
* A **strong affinity with Business to IT**: writing stories, hunting bugs, refinement, testing and putting releases to production is one of the key elements of your job
* Very **data-savvy**. Databases are not new to you and it is an absolute pre if you have at least some basic skills with Oracle SQL
* A **passion for investments**: you don't have to know everything about investments, but you need to be passionate to put time and energy in increasing your craftmanship in the field of investments
* **Love to work in a complex environment** where a strong growth ambition, complex rules and regulations and IT challenges come together
* A **digital first mindset** and have an idea on how we can develop our products in such a way that processes are simple and STP (Straight-Through Processing)
* **Handle pressure and keep on smiling** in case of incident management, you dare to take initiative, ask for advice and make a decisions
* **Strong analytical skills** and are mighty curious to understand how things work in a complex environment

  

Don't worry if you do not meet all the criteria. If you feel that you might be a good fit for this position, we would love to hear from you. Always provide a cover letter telling us your story.
  

  

**Rewards & benefits**  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

  

**Want to apply directly?**  

  

Upload your **CV and motivation letter** by clicking the "Apply" button. Your motivational letter is crucial for us to understand what your drive and ambitions are in this role, with ING and your ambitions. Therefor **we cannot consider any applications without a suitable cover letter.**

title: Credit Risk Specialist
description:
Credit Risk Specialist
We are a highly motivated team that specialises in credit risk policies, regulations, and governance. Our goal is to set and maintain ING's global Credit Risk Framework and group credit risk policies ensuring a compliant and up to date policy house. We are the subject matter experts on credit risk regulations being the centre of competence and responsible for knowledge sharing within ING Group. Additionally, the team has an oversight role on policy compliance and implementation.
  

  

For this team ING is seeking for two **credit risk specialists** who focus on **testing** **policy compliance of credit risk related topics** . The Credit Risk Policy team works from our head office in Amsterdam.
  

  

ING is committed to executing its business with the highest level of integrity, including strict compliance with all applicable laws and regulations of the markets and jurisdictions in which it operates. And credit risk, as the most important banking risk, is managed within rigid external and internal requirements which our policies and business colleagues must adhere to allow ING to achieve its strategic objectives. That's why it is so important to have strong internal controls for policy compliance and intervene before there are any negative consequences due to non-compliance.
  

  

**What you'll do**
  

* You will be primarily responsible for testing adherence to ING's distressed debt management policies (Definition of Default, Early Warning Indicators and Forbearance).
* You will select risk-based samples, also using data analyses.
* You will collaborate, be trained and report to senior policy experts.
* You will register observations, identify root causes, and produce suggestions for improvement & concrete recommendations.
* You will, together with your senior colleagues bring this to senior management.
* You will build and maintain a stakeholder field with respective 1st and 2nd line teams.
* You will work in a team where we discuss performance, identify improvements, and learn from each other.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

**Personal qualities and behavioural traits**
  

* Fluent in English.
* With a master's degree or equivalent.
* With strong analytical and reading skills, able to understand, digest, and interpret credit risk policies and credit packs.
* With strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* With proficiency in data analysis (using ING applications like Vortex, Vantage, ARIA etc.).
* With the ability to identify problems. Discussing and solving them with your senior colleagues.
* With the ability to value different perspectives, and think critical and independently.
* With the ability to 'get people on board' being thorough and persuasive.

  

**Preferred qualifications**
  

* Experience in quality assurance monitoring and/or internal/external audit.
* Practical knowledge & experience with credit risk regulations (CRR, EBA Guidelines on NPL, DoD).
* Experience as a credit risk analyst: conducting in-depth analysis of credit applications, incl. analysis of credit structures and risks, in-depth financial analysis, and business risk assessment.
* Certification in Audit, Non-Financial Risk or (Quantitative) Risk Management.

  

**What we offer**
  

* Challenging work with the possibility to show added value while realising your ambitions.
* An informal environment with colleagues willing to teach & help each other, celebrating success.
* The opportunity to learn and acquire in dept knowledge on credit risk policies, regulations and related internal ING processes.
* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience (**scale 9/10**).
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working from the office and working from home.
* A job for 36 to 40 hours.
* Reimbursement for travel expenses.
* 24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% Holiday payment.

  

**Questions?**
  

  

Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.
  

  

**About us**
  

  

With around 60,000 employees and operations in over 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a difference. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

If you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring, and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Senior Market Risk Analyst
description:
Senior Market Risk Analyst
As the Market Risk Management team of ING NL we are an energetic team of highly qualified professionals, responsible for managing the balance sheet of ING NL. We do this by hedging our interest rate and liquidity risks in close cooperation with the ING Group Treasury department. We maintain close relations with our business stakeholders, advise them on product and pricing changes and make them aware of all relevant (macro-economic) trends and consequences such as the developments of the interest rates in the market.
  

  

**The Team**
  

  

Our Market Risk Management team consists of about 30 experts, determined to advise our business stakeholders to deliver on our purpose to achieve sustainable progress for all. Client behaviour is crucial to us and we use lots of data to explore, model and forecast it with state-of-the-art modelling methods and technologies. The position offers excellent opportunities to broaden your market risk / asset & liability management and data analytics competencies while further developing your soft skills by advising and collaborating with our stakeholders. We work in an agile way and we believe that empowerment is crucial for you to flourish and be successful.
  

  

Besides our core ALM activities, our team is involved in strategic programs such as the full migration to the target ALM solution of ING Group built in QRM and the transfer of the mortgages administration to STATER. Hence, this position offers opportunities to contribute to these impactful change programs as well.
  

  

**Role & Responsibilities**
  

  

We are looking for a colleague who wants to develop a successful career in managing market risks.
  

* You will become responsible for managing roughly EUR 150-180 bio. of assets and liabilities contributing to around one-third of the overall ING P&L. You will perform this responsibility in one of our squads.
* Your main task is to hedge the balance sheet in order to realise a stable margin and Net Interest Income for ING. The hedges are largely dependent on client behaviour, so you will monitor and model the behaviour and spot emerging trends using big data analytics.
* Because our hedges influence the cost price of our products, you will be asked for advice by the business tribes in pricing and product decisions. In doing so, you have to know all the details of our product offerings (mortgages, savings, current accounts, business loans, consumer loans).
* You will play a central role within ING and your activities will impact ING's overall P&L. Your success will depend on your ability to maintain good relations with our stakeholders, i.e. CRO NL divisions, Finance, the Business Tribes, Group Financial Risk, Model Validation, Group Treasury and also our external stakeholders ECB, DNB and the external auditor of ING.
* You take part - directly or indirectly - in the migration of ING NL to QRM for the monthly hedging process and the migration of our mortgages administration to STATER.

  

**How to succeed**
  

* An academic degree (MSc or PhD), preferably in Econometrics or other quantitative studies such as Mathematics, Engineering & Physics
* Finished additional professional qualifications in the financial risk field such as CFA, FRM, or the willingness to do so
* Minimum of 7 to 10 years of relevant experience in the financial sector (e.g. banking, insurance, consulting)
* Extensive knowledge of financial risk management, relevant regulations, e.g. Basel/IRRBB, modelling and hedging techniques
* Knowledge of - and preferably experience with the parameterization of - behavioural ALM models (prepayment, non-maturing deposit modelling)
* Experience in being a sparring partner/advisor to Senior Management
* Experience with SQL and coding (e.g. Python, R) is an advantage as well as experience with QRM, and/or other ALM systems
* And of course you should be fluent in English

  

Furthermore, you should adhere to the ING values and it is evident for you that your behaviour is fully aligned with these values. You should also be prepared to take the Banker's Oath.
  

  

For more information, please visit http://www.ing.jobs/Netherlands/Why-ING/This-is-ING-too/ING-Values.htm
  

  

**Rewards & benefits**
  

  

We want to make sure that you can strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm.
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* Hybrid working mode (flexible working from home and office).
* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th-month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% Holiday payment.
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities.
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues.
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster.

  

**About us**
  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? title: Business Analyst - ESG Operational Readiness
description:
Business Analyst - ESG Operational Readiness
ING aims to put sustainability at the heart of what we do, defining new ways of doing business where the planet and people are just as important as economic growth. It's about making progress together, step by step.
  

  

With climate change posing an unparalleled challenge to our planet's health and the sustainability of societies and economies worldwide, ING is committed to contributing to the global transition to a low-carbon, climate-resilient economy. One of the ways ING can make a positive impact on climate action is through our financing efforts. We aim to get a grip on the CO2 emissions of our lending portfolio and guide our customers' sustainable transitions.
  

  

**The team**
  

  

As part of ING's commitment to sustainable growth, we are building the ESG Operational Readiness Team within the Global COO Risk Services Organization and are seeking an Product Owner to join us. You will play a crucial part in the team by actively working on ESG programs for the bank and work with domain experts, and implementation teams across different business lines (Wholesale Banking, Business Banking, and Retail Banking) to ESG data delivery, making them ready for reporting.
  

  

**Roles and responsibilities**
  

* Oversee data collection activities by collaborating with ESG capability owners across ING to manage the end-to-end data delivery process.
* Refine, implement and operationalize the end-to-end ESG data flow in line with QBR demands, including building a DataMart if needed, collecting data, and ensuring its availability for reporting purposes.
* Enhance data delivery processes, ensuring the quality, consistency, and accuracy of data.
* Refine and implement a global Physical Risk calculation tool for Retail, Wholesale, and Business Banking.
* Foster connections among colleagues, topics, and expertise, maintaining continuous communication with all relevant stakeholders.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

* Ability to collect, process, and analyze large and complex datasets from various sources.
* Ability to ensure the accuracy and completeness of ESG data, making it ready for reporting.
* Ability to identify more efficient methods for data collection and ingestion.
* Ability to Translate stakeholder requirements into actionable implementation plans.
* Commit to learning new ESG concepts, regulations, and industry best practices in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work data-driven and provide insights based on relevant ESG indicators, with curiosity and drive to stay updated on sustainability trends.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Senior Data Scientist**The team**
  

  

ING's goal is to enable people to "do their thing" and empower them to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are one of the largest banks in Europe and we continuously evolve to become one of the most innovative companies in the banking sector. The ING Analytics group is a major driving force in ING's transformation, aimed at helping us to become a data-driven organization, where advanced analytics is at the heart of our business processes.
  

  

In our tribe COOA, we apply analytics & AI solutions for the Financial Crime & Fraud domains and create advanced analytics applications and models. These models are used to mitigate and to effectively tackle the risk of financial crime for our customers and our society, making us a safer and more compliant bank. Our group consists of more than two dozen data scientists, engineers, data analysts, and customer journey experts, working together to deliver innovative solutions in our domain across multiple countries.
  

  

**Roles and responsibilities**
  

  

As we continue our growth and establishing the added value analytics bring to our domains, we seek to a senior data science profile in order to:
  

  

* Develop an expertise in applying machine learning for outlier detection, representation learning, entity resolution, and network & graph applications.

  

* Adopt best practices and quality standards for developing & deploying fit-for-purpose model pipelines, addressing the requirements of the ING model governance.

  

* Be an effective member of a model development & implementation squad, challenge the status quo and build what matters.

  

* Actively learn about our domain, reach out to our stakeholders, and tell captivating stories with our data to create a journey that makes our bank and our society safer.

  

**Who should apply?**
  

  

At ING, we promote diversity not just because it is the right thing to do, but because it's essential for delivering on our strategy. In order to stay a step ahead we need teams with a healthy mix of contrasting perspectives and backgrounds as they are more creative, faster to adapt and more inventive with their solutions. We strive to hire a workforce as diverse as the communities in which we operate, and we will consider every application, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability or age.
  

  

**How to succeed**
  

* You have at least 5 years of (global) work experience in the Data Science space (methods, technology, data) including statistical modelling and machine learning experience to solve business questions and/or develop (innovative) data driven products
* Experience in applying data science to prevent and detect financial crimes (e.g. internal/external fraud, money laundering, terrorism financing, tax evasion, ...) is a strong plus
* You can explain complicated subjects clearly
* You are friendly and approachable and are able to mentor junior data scientists
* Your enthusiasm is visible and you are good with mobilizing people for our data driven purpose
* You are motivated to keep on top of the latest developments
* You have extensive knowledge of a wide range of machine learning algorithms, ranging from more classical econometric models to cutting-edge neural networks and are able to match them to business problems
* You are able to see where ING can set further steps towards becoming a truly data driven bank. You're always thinking one step ahead, for example in advising about the best way of implementation.
* You are a team player who strikes effective balance between independence and acting in the interest of the team

  

**Experience**
  

* MSc or PhD with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics or similar.
* Machine Learning: Classification, Regression, Clustering, Unsupervised methods, Text Mining. You have an excellent understanding of Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Neural Networks, Logistic Regression, SVM, KNN, K-Means, etc. Parametric and non-parametric statistics is a pre.
* Programming Languages: Python and R. Scala is a pre-requisite
* Tools: Spark, Hadoop.
* Database handling: SQL, Hive. Familiarity with Oracle, Netezza, HBase, Cassandra, Graph databases is a pre.
* Visualisation tools: D3.js, Shiny, Angular.

title: Credit Risk Test Engineer
description:
Credit Risk Test Engineer
At ING, we believe it's your ideas, not your age that matter. As part of our team, you'll work in a dynamic, international environment where you learn at a fast pace and be hands-on from the start.
  

  

COO Risk sits right at the heart of the Bank's complexity. We translate our rather complex banking business exposures into impact on risk weighted assets and provisions in line with the constantly changing business desires and the latest regulatory requirements.
  

  

COO Risk delivers baseline and change activities for the Risk Organization with the purpose to drive our partners to maximize value in a safe & compliant environment. We play a critical role at ING and service all business lines, CROs and COOs of the Bank. COO Risk is committed to take explicit ownership of the end-to-end execution of regulatory transformation initiatives.
  

  

**The team**
  

  

The vacancy is located in the Group Finance and Risk Reporting Product. This team is responsible for delivering, documenting and maintaining the solutions for data driven regulatory and finance reporting with credit risk data. The area of expertise is Credit Risk Reporting. Topics that are on top of the agenda are, for example: identification, design and implementation of ESG requirements, Basel IV/CRR3 and maintaining the data quality framework within Vortex.
  

  

**Roles and responsibilities**
  

  

The squads falling under Group Finance and Risk Reporting comprise of different roles. Each squad has a Product Owner, Business Analysts, Developer and Test Engineers. For one of the squads we are now looking for a solid test engineer. In this role you will:
  

* Actively engage and participate in different stages of stories from Business Analysis to end of test cycles
* Perform various kind of testing: System Test, Functional Test, Integration Test
* Defining test strategies, test plans and test cases and implementing improvements therein
* Responsible for the execution of the test and reporting on the quality and processes
* Fulfilling the QA role within the squad and chapter
* Assessing and accepting the delivered software and securing the quality
* Guard the quality of the software delivered by the team
* Have a driving role in increase the automation of end-2-end chain tests, in a repetitive fashion
* Actively busy making automated tests, do some manual testing and increase the test coverage day by day
* Take your responsibility around quality of user stories of the backlog
* Make improvements to the testing process
* Analyzing results
* Liaising with other teams and areas of expertise (developers, business analysts, peer testers, etc.)
* Taking the testing process to the next level

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

Technical skills - Must Haves
  

* Excellent knowledge and experience with different test methodologies, test design techniques, and test automation
* Experience with data comparison tools
* Excellent knowledge of Oracle required  

	+ Experienced PL/SQL packages and stored procedures
	+ Experienced with query writing
	+ Experienced with query tuning
	+ Experienced with Oracle database setup
* Excellent knowledge of CI/CD using Azure DevOps  

	+ Experienced with setting up new pipelines in Azure DevOps
	+ Experienced with setting up Ansible playbooks
* Experience with front end testing : Selenium
* Experience with BDD (TDD), Cucumber, Rest Assured
* Experience with white-box testing
* Good at scripting (Bash, Python)
* Basic Knowledge and experience with data warehousing, data models

  

Nice to Have
  

* Experience with performance testing (Jmeter, Gatling)
* Experience with API testing (Postman, SoapUI),
* Experience with UAC
* Familiarity with ELK monitoring
* Specific Credit Risk testing experience

  

Soft Skills
  

* Strong communication skills (clear, concise, timely, courage to speak up, etc.)
* Think ahead (planning, dependencies, etc.)
* Proactive
* Takes initiative
* Understands and show behavioral competencies regarding Impediments Management
* Planning & Organization
* Self -organized
* You take it on and **make it happen**
* You help others to be **successful**
* You are always a **step ahead**
* Honest
* Prudent
* Responsible
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail

  

Certifications
  

* Oracle Database SQL Certified Associate
* Python
* Oracle Certified Associate (OCA)
* Agile Test Certification (ISTQB Agile Tester Extension or Certified Agile Tester) or TMAP
* Certified Software Test Automation Specialist

  

**Rewards and benefits**
  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at http://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

  

**About us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
  

  

**Questions?**
  

  

Contact Lesley van Alst-Leendertse or Leon Dusée for more information about this opportunity. Ready to apply? Use the link below to upload your motivation letter and CV.
  

  

Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions
description:
Senior Data Analyst - Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions
English vacancy text below
  

  

Bij ING streven we ernaar de beste mobiele bank van het continent te worden. De Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is daarbij verantwoordelijk voor het realiseren van de digitale verkoopdoelstellingen en voor het verzorgen en verbeteren van alle digitale interacties met klanten. Daarnaast zorgen we er met meer dan 70 data analisten en data scientists voordat we de transitie naar een volledig data-gedreven organisatie versnellen.
  

  

**Jij start binnen 'Personalisatie'.**  

  

Dit is een analytics team met 4 data analisten en 2 customer journey experts. Samen zorgen zij ervoor dat klanten een gepersonaliseerde beleving in de ING bankieren app hebben. Binnen het team vervul jij een rol die op het snijvlak van data analist en customer journey expert ligt. Je zal het bedrijf ingaan en kansen spotten om met analytics oplossingen, het creëren, onderhouden en aanbieden van digitale personalisatie makkelijker te maken voor je collega's. Je ziet waar de behoeften van je collega's liggen, weet die te vertalen naar analytics producten en werkt mee aan de bouw en implementatie daarvan. Daarvoor is nauwe samenwerking met IT en de business cruciaal. Je bent dus ongeveer de helft van je tijd consultancy werkzaamheden aan het doen en de andere helft van je tijd data analisten werk.
  

  

Als je je na een paar jaar bij 'personalisatie' op een andere plek binnen het bedrijf verder wil ontwikkelen binnen het bedrijf als senior data analist, dan zijn daar volop mogelijkheden voor. We nemen je aan als data analist en je komt daarmee in de poule van 70 data analisten die we uitzenden over het bedrijf.
  

  

**Naar wie zijn we op zoek?**  

  

We zijn op zoek naar een door de wol geverfde data analist, met affiniteit met IT, die het leuk vindt om naast het technische werk ook interne consultancy werkzaamheden op te pakken. Je bent een echte innovator en in staat om een paar stappen verder door te denken dan anderen. Je weet structurele analytics oplossingen te bedenken voor complexe problemen en snapt ook hoe je deze ideeën kunt omzetten naar praktische implementatie.
  

  

**Als data analist:**  

* Heb je een passie voor fact-based werken en beslissingen maken
* Identificeer je nieuwe oplossingen en ideeën om impact te maken met behulp van data en analyses
* Ben je in staat om behoeftes binnen het bedrijf te identificeren en aansluitend hierop nieuwe data producten en analytics oplossingen te bedenken en bouwen
* Weet je als geen ander stakeholder management te bedrijven en anderen mee te krijgen in veranderingen
* Ervaring met Martech of online personalisatie vanuit analytics perspectief is een pré

  

Heeft data analyse voor jou geen geheimen meer en wil je jezelf verbreden en ontwikkelen door meer consultancy werkzaamheden aan je baan toe te voegen? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!
  

  

**Je competenties en ervaring**  

* Je hebt een master op het gebied van analytics, wiskunde of econometrie
* Je hebt 10+ jaar ervaring in analytics
* Je hebt ruime ervaring met querytalen (bijvoorbeeld SQL, SAS, Python)
* Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met IT en artificiële intelligentie
* Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring in het maken van complexe analyses
* Je kunt data transformeren in inzichten en deze op een begrijpelijke manier presenteren
* Je hebt een aanpakkersmentaliteit. Je leert graag snel en past nieuwe technieken toe
* Je bent klantgericht
* Je kunt goed omgaan met verschillende type stakeholders bijvoorbeeld mede dataspecialisten, marketeers, engineers of risk collega's.
* Je vraagt actief om hulp en feedback en durft feedback te geven
* Je stelt het belang van het team waarin je werkt boven je eigen belang
* Je spreekt vloeiend Engels. Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is een plus
* Ervaring met de agile manier van werken is een pré

  

**Wat bieden wij jou?**  

  

Wij bieden een fulltime 36 uurspositie in een uitdagende omgeving. Je krijgt de kans om bij een moderne agile organisatie te werken met intelligente en leuke collega's en vele kansen om zowel je technische als persoonlijke competenties verder te ontwikkelen. Elke 3 weken komen we met de 70 data analisten bij elkaar om met en van elkaar te leren
  

  

**De voordelen van werken bij ING zijn onder andere:**  

* Een uitstekend salaris dat aansluit bij je kwaliteiten en ervaring
* Een werkweek van 36 uur
* 24-27 vakantiedagen afhankelijk van het contract
* Een 13e maand en 8% vakantiegeld
* Bijdrage Individuele besparingen (BIS), 3,5% van je bruto jaarsalaris
* Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerken (hybride modus)
* De mobiliteitskaart. Je kiest je vervoerswijze voor het woon-werkverkeer per dag. Vrijheid en flexibiliteit in mobiliteit.
* Een pensioenplan
* Persoonlijke groeimogelijkheden en uitdagend werk met eindeloze mogelijkheden
* Een informele werkomgeving met diverse groep van innovatieve collega's

  

Bekijk hier de ING employee benefits: Benefits | ING
  

  

**Ben je enthousiast? Klik dan op de knop Solliciteren**  

  

Laat ons weten waarom jij bent wie wij zoeken: hoe ga je je ervaring gebruiken om ING nog beter te maken? Graag ontvangen wij een CV én motivatiebrief.
  

  

**Meer informatie?**  

  

Neem contact op met Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) voor vragen.
  

  

ING is looking for a Senior Data Analyst - Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions
  

  

**Who are we?**  

  

At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is responsible for achieving the digital sales objectives and for enhancing all digital interactions with customers. Additionally 70 data analysts and scientists work to accelerate our transition to a fully data-driven organization.
  

  

You will join the 'Personalization' team which consists of 4 data analysts and 2 customer journey experts. Together, they ensure a personalized experience for customers in the ING banking app. Your role will blend data analysis and customer journey expertise. You will identify opportunities to simplify digital personalization for colleagues using analytics solutions, translating their needs into analytics solutions and collaborating closely with IT and business teams. Your time will be split between consultancy work and data analysis.
  

  

After a few years in 'Personalization, opportunities for further development as a senior data analyst within the company will be available. You will join as a data analyst and be part of the pool of 70 data analysts deployed across the company.
  

  

**Who are we looking for?**  

  

We are looking for a seasoned data analyst with an affinity for IT who enjoys combining technical work with internal consultancy tasks. You are an innovator, capable of thinking several steps ahead, devising structural analytics solutions for complex problems, and knowing how to implement these ideas practically.
  

  

As a data analyst, you:
  

* Have a passion for fact-based decision-making.
* Identify new solutions and ideas to create impact using data and analysis.
* Can identify company needs and develop new data products and analytics solutions accordingly.
* Excel in stakeholder management and can drive others to embrace changes.
* Experience with Martech or online personalization from an analytics perspective is a plus.

  

If data analysis holds no secrets for you and you want to broaden your role by incorporating more consultancy tasks, we are looking for you!
  

  

**Your competencies and experience**  

* You hold a master's degree in analytics, mathematics, or econometrics.
* You have over 10 years of experience in analytics
* You have ample experience with query languages (e.g., SQL, SAS, Python)
* You have demonstrated affinity with IT and artificial intelligence.
* You possess strong analytical skills and experience in conducting complex analyses.
* You can transform data into insights and present them clearly.
* You have a proactive attitude, learn quickly, and apply new techniques.
* You are customer-oriented.
* You are adept at interacting with various stakeholders, such as fellow data specialists, marketers, engineers, or risk colleagues.
* You actively seek help and feedback and are willing to give feedback.
* You prioritize the interests of your team over your own.
* You are fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch is a plus.

  

**What do we offer you?**  

  

We offer a full-time 36-hour position in a challenging environment. You will have a chance to work at a modern Agile organization with smart and fun colleagues and great opportunities to develop both your technical and personal competencies.
  

  

**The benefits of working at ING include:**  

* An excellent salary that matches your qualities and experience
* A 36-hour working week
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
* A 13th month and 8% holiday allowance
* Contribution Individual Savings (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Flexible working hours and working from home (hybrid mode)
* The Mobility Card. You choose your mode of transport for commuting per day. Freedom and flexibility in mobility.
* A pension plan
* Personal growth opportunities and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with a diverse group of innovative colleagues

  

See here the ING employee benefits: Benefits | ING
  

  

**Are you excited? Then click on the apply button**  

  

Let us know why you are who we are looking for: how will you use your experience to make ING even better? We would like to receive your CV and motivation letter.
  

  

**More information?**  

  

Please contact Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) for your questions.
